seg.seg: (The threefold world) the good ones traverse due to energy. Eventually the strong ones attain Buddhahood. Not in the least must energy be decried. 1.
There is no other thing that has turned out to the detriment of the whole world [circle of existences] as much as iner-
tia [has]. For in earlier days the food of humans was rice, uncultivated and chaff-less, and clothes made ready on wishing trees
were theirs to put on. [But] due to the collecting of rice by a listless person the wishing trees
disappeared for them, the cotton plants became visible for them [in place of the wishing trees]. The uncultivated, chaff-less rice [also] disappeared for them, it [only] became visible
through great labour (and with) the chaff. Of listlessness, however, energy is the opposite, therefore in my opinion,
energy is superior to all (in the world). Śilpavān [“the skillful one”] speaks: The skillfulness of humans is superior to all, because: || K.---
|| The good reputation of a craftsman is spread in region after region. He worthy of being treated with reverence and worthy to gather the adulation of humans;
property, even if well kept, will inevitably be fully lost: water, fire, kings and thieves certainly cut off the hope/security (?), but the skill will never be lost.
Besitz, [auch] wenn er behütet wird, muss zugrunde gehen: Wasser, Feuer, Könige [und] Diebe zerstören die Sicherheit(?); aber die Kunstfertigkeit geht nicht verloren.
Possessions, [even] when guarded, must perish: water, fire, kings [and] thieves destroy safety(?); but artistry is never lost.
and skill is the root of possession. 1. And as often as an artist creates an art(istic)
Anytime an artist creates a work of art he has five advantages [from it]. (cf 5)

Und wie oft/immer ein Kunstfertiger ein Kunstwerk zustande bringt (Med.), ebenso oft/immer werden ihm fünf Vorteile [daraus]: Der erste Vorteil ist für ihn das ausgeführte Werk, es kommt ihm zustande (Akt.). Der zweite [Vorteil] ...
And as often/however as an artist creates a piece of art, just so often/always five benefits become [of it for] him.
object, so often he has five advantages [from it]. One advantage to him is the object created, it comes into existence.
The second is the pleasure arisen from the skill; the third, he receives friendship from the beings; the fourth, [he obtains] students,
